video.title: The West Wing
video.synopsis: This powerful political epic chronicles the triumphs and travails of White House senior staff under the administration of President Josiah Bartlet.

episodes.synopsis: The senior members of the White House staff are summoned to the office early in the morning to handle several difficult situations.
episodes.title: Pilot

episodes.synopsis: Leo hires Mandy as a consultant to the president. Vice President Hoynes rebuffs C.J. when she tries to discuss a comment he made.
episodes.title: Post Hoc, Ergo Propter Hoc

episodes.synopsis: When Danny, a reporter, learns about Sam's relationship with a call girl, he doesn't write a story about it because C.J. gives Danny a bigger lead.
episodes.title: A Proportional Response

episodes.synopsis: The staff has 72 hours to rescue a gun-control bill that needs five more votes in Congress to pass.
episodes.title: Five Votes Down

episodes.synopsis: Leo assigns his senior staff the task of conducting private meetings with fringe groups that want attention from the White House.
episodes.title: The Crackpots and These Women

episodes.synopsis: A mentally unbalanced woman with a gun climbs the White House fence. The Secret Service foils her plan to target Zoey.
episodes.title: Mr. Willis of Ohio

episodes.synopsis: The president and first lady host a tense dinner at the White House honoring the president of Indonesia and his wife. Danny flirts with C.J.
episodes.title: The State Dinner

episodes.synopsis: The president embarrasses Hoynes during a meeting. In order to keep the story from print, C.J. arranges a meeting between Danny and the president.
episodes.title: Enemies

episodes.synopsis: The president confidentially chooses Judge Harrison as his nominee for the Supreme Court. His staff continues to search Harrison's past.
episodes.title: The Short List

episodes.synopsis: Sam and Josh work on thwarting Congressman Lillienfield's accusation about drug abuse in the White House. Leo tells Bartlet he may have to resign.
episodes.title: In Excelsis Deo

episodes.synopsis: When India invades Kashmir and Bartlet worries about a nuclear threat to both countries, he asks a colorful ex-ambassador to help with the crisis.
episodes.title: Lord John Marbury

episodes.synopsis: The president and his staff prepare the State of the Union Address, but he becomes ill. His naval doctor examines him in the living quarters.
episodes.title: 'He Shall, from Time to Time...'

episodes.synopsis: The parents of a murdered gay student are invited to witness the president sign a hate crimes bill into law.
episodes.title: Take out the Trash Day

episodes.synopsis: On a Friday evening, the United States Supreme Court rejects the application for a stay of execution for Simon Cruz.
episodes.title: Take This Sabbath Day

episodes.synopsis: Sam and Toby rush to Connecticut to help Supreme Court nominee Roberto Mendoza, who was wrongfully arrested for drunk driving because he's Hispanic.
episodes.title: Celestial Navigation

episodes.synopsis: The president and his staff fly to Los Angeles for a big fundraiser, but the powerful Hollywood mogul hosting the event threatens to cancel.
episodes.title: 20 Hours in L.A

episodes.synopsis: The first lady's public comments on a White House appointment create problems for the president because he's afraid of incurring his wife's wrath.
episodes.title: The White House Pro-Am

episodes.synopsis: The Senate confirms Mendoza's appointment to the Supreme Court. Josh interviews a nominee for Assistant AG who favors reparations for slavery.
episodes.title: Six Meetings Before Lunch

episodes.synopsis: Two members of the Federal Election Commission resign. Sam and Toby meet with military officers and congressmen to discuss gays in the military.
episodes.title: Let Bartlet Be Bartlet

episodes.synopsis: Refusing to consider input from party leaders, the president announces his two nominations to the Federal Election Commission.
episodes.title: Mandatory Minimums

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet works to reform campaign finance by changing the makeup of the members on the Federal Campaign Commission.
episodes.title: Lies, Damn Lies and Statistics

episodes.synopsis: An American fighter plane gets shot down over Iraq, and, eventually, the pilot is successfully rescued. The space shuttle has mechanical problems.
episodes.title: What Kind of Day Has It Been

episodes.synopsis: President Bartlet is rushed to the hospital and undergoes surgery after being shot during an assassination attempt.
episodes.title: In the Shadow of Two Gunmen: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: As doctors continue to perform surgery on Josh's chest, he recalls in a dream how the staff became members of the Bartlet political team.
episodes.title: In the Shadow of Two Gunmen: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: In the months leading up to the midterm elections, the staff makes an all-out effort to pick up Democratic seats in congress.
episodes.title: The Midterms

episodes.synopsis: Toby and Josh help Bartlet mediate between the leader of an AIDS-ravaged, poverty-stricken African nation and drug company executives.
episodes.title: In This White House

episodes.synopsis: C.J. finds a way to stop a retiring general from going on television to attack the president's position on military budget cuts.
episodes.title: And It's Surely to Their Credit

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet considers the extraordinary measure of calling congress together during its winter holiday to force a vote on a nuclear test-ban treaty.
episodes.title: The Lame Duck Congress

episodes.synopsis: While flying to Oregon, Bartlet deals with a small crisis involving a Sudanese oil tanker, a same-sex marriage bill and an upcoming education speech.
episodes.title: The Portland Trip

episodes.synopsis: As Thanksgiving arrives, Bartlet decides the fate of illegal Chinese immigrants who claim to be Christians seeking asylum from religious persecution.
episodes.title: Shibboleth

episodes.synopsis: The Russian government claims an explosion in its country occurred at an oil refinery, but evidence proves it happened in a nuclear missile silo.
episodes.title: Galileo

episodes.synopsis: Leo hires a traumatologist to force Josh to confront the stress brought about by being shot. Meanwhile, Sam deals with an errant energy secretary.
episodes.title: Noël

episodes.synopsis: At the start of the new legislative session, Bartlet's staff prepares for a presidential breakfast meeting with Democrat and Republican leaders.
episodes.title: The Leadership Breakfast

episodes.synopsis: Leo and the others are irritated by the news that pompous Lord John Marbury has been appointed Britain's ambassador to the United States.
episodes.title: The Drop In

episodes.synopsis: Sam learns that a policeman whom Bartlet praised during his speech was charged with beating a suspect 17 years earlier.
episodes.title: Bartlet's Third State of the Union

episodes.synopsis: Three hours after learning that drug agents were taken hostage in Colombia, Bartlet gives the order for Special Forces to rescue them, risking a war.
episodes.title: The War at Home

episodes.synopsis: Surgeon General Millicent Griffith's comments about the medical effects of marijuana appear to reverse the president's stance on legalizing the drug.
episodes.title: Ellie

episodes.synopsis: Sam tries to help Donna's friend, whose dying father wants his deceased dad cleared of committing espionage during World War II.
episodes.title: Somebody's Going to Emergency, Somebody's Going to Jail

episodes.synopsis: A senator delays a vote because he wants more stringent requirements for diagnosing and treating autism added to a child health-care reform bill.
episodes.title: The Stackhouse Filibuster

episodes.synopsis: Hoynes suspects that Bartlet won't attempt a second term, and Toby is shocked to learn Bartlet has multiple sclerosis.
episodes.title: 17 People

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet reluctantly consults the new White House counsel, Oliver Babish, who is stunned by the legal implications of Bartlet's condition.
episodes.title: Bad Moon Rising

episodes.synopsis: After learning about Bartlet's disease, C.J. realizes that she may have unwittingly been part of a criminal conspiracy to deceive the public.
episodes.title: The Fall's Gonna Kill You

episodes.synopsis: After Joey gives Bartlet and his staff devastating polling figures, they debate how to inform the public about the president's multiple sclerosis.
episodes.title: 18th and Potomac

episodes.synopsis: Josh independently implements a rash plan to coerce wayward Democrats to support the administration's lawsuit against big tobacco companies.
episodes.title: Two Cathedrals

episodes.synopsis: With the White House in security lockdown, Bartlet and his staff must cope with the fallout of a terrorist attack.
episodes.title: Isaac and Ishmael

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet announces his reelection bid. Storms complicate a Haitian rescue mission. Bartlet and his staff travel to New Hampshire to campaign.
episodes.title: Manchester: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet refines his speech for a major reelection announcement, while his staff works uneasily with a heavyweight political strategist.
episodes.title: Manchester: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: A fearless special prosecutor begins investigating Bartlet's failure to disclose his illness and issues subpoenas to the White House staff.
episodes.title: Ways and Means

episodes.synopsis: As a State Department dinner nears, Bartlet boldly vetoes the "death tax" bill, but the House has enough votes to immediately override the veto.
episodes.title: On the Day Before

episodes.synopsis: After a church shooting, Bartlet asks Hoynes to speak at an antigun rally in Texas, but the uneasy allies confront each other in a frank showdown.
episodes.title: War Crimes

episodes.synopsis: When an American spy submarine suddenly loses contact with the U.S. in hostile North Korean waters, a concerned Bartlet seeks advice.
episodes.title: Gone Quiet

episodes.synopsis: While Bartlet worries about where he will be on Thanksgiving, C.J. meets with two American Indians who are camped in the White House lobby.
episodes.title: The Indians in the Lobby

episodes.synopsis: At Abbey's urging, Josh meets with a powerful women's caucus over the proposed language of a United Nations treaty banning prostitution.
episodes.title: The Women of Qumar

episodes.synopsis: Leo fears the worst when he testifies in the congressional investigation into Bartlet's lack of public disclosure about his illness.
episodes.title: Bartlet for America

episodes.synopsis: Leo defiantly rejects the Congressional Oversight Committee's offer of a public censure of Bartlet that would bring an end to the investigation.
episodes.title: H. Con - 172

episodes.synopsis: While the White House staff works intensely on Bartlet's crucial State of the Union speech, Bartlet suddenly demands the inclusion of a bold promise.
episodes.title: 100,000 Airplanes

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet and his staff ponder whether or not to counter a fast-rising Republican presidential candidate's verbal assault on affirmative action.
episodes.title: The Two Bartlets

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet consults a psychiatrist, Dr. Stanley Keyworth, for a troubling sleep disorder and receives a sobering personal assessment.
episodes.title: Night Five

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet engages both Sam and Toby in intricate chess matches that mirror the wily game of brinksmanship that Bartlet is playing with the Chinese.
episodes.title: Hartsfield's Landing

episodes.synopsis: As Abbey contemplates the likelihood that her medical license will be taken away, she grumpily attends a big White House party for her birthday.
episodes.title: Dead Irish Writers

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet makes a disparaging comment about a potential Republican nominee after a television interview, not realizing that he is still being recorded.
episodes.title: The U.S. Poet Laureate

episodes.synopsis: When a truck carrying uranium fuel rods crashes in a remote Idaho tunnel, Bartlet's staff prepares for an environmental -- or terrorist -- crisis.
episodes.title: Stirred

episodes.synopsis: The West Wing blends drama with reality in this groundbreaking documentary episode featuring interviews with ex-presidents and White House figures.
episodes.title: The West Wing Special Episode

episodes.synopsis: As Sam finalizes the details of Bartlet's upcoming summit with the Russian president, satellite photographs reveal an Iranian nuclear bomb facility.
episodes.title: Enemies Foreign and Domestic

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet rushes to deal with an anticipated terrorist attack over a broad area. Toby clashes with network execs over political convention coverage.
episodes.title: The Black Vera Wang

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet agonizes about forfeiting the principle of diplomatic immunity for an important Middle Eastern official who's known to be plotting terrorism.
episodes.title: We Killed Yamamoto

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet makes a crucial decision regarding a foreign diplomat who is a known terrorist. He ponders the situation during a performance of Henry VI.
episodes.title: Posse Comitatus

episodes.synopsis: The reelection campaign of Bartlet is underway and moving so quickly that after a speech in Indiana, Josh, Toby and Donna are mistakenly left behind.
episodes.title: 20 Hours in America: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: The reelection campaign of President Bartlet is underway and moving so quickly that Josh, Toby and Donna are accidentally left behind in Indiana.
episodes.title: 20 Hours in America: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet's staff prepares a legal team to deal with the inquiry into Bartlet's involvement in the Qumari assassination.
episodes.title: College Kids

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet ponders the potential consequences of ordering a strike force to overtake a barricaded gang of domestic terrorists in Iowa.
episodes.title: The Red Mass

episodes.synopsis: While on a weekend retreat to prepare for the crucial upcoming debates, Bartlet must also deal with an Israeli air attack on Qumar.
episodes.title: Debate Camp

episodes.synopsis: One day before a debate between Bartlet and his Republican rival, Governor Robert Ritchie, even skeptical Toby must admit that Bartlet is ready.
episodes.title: Game On

episodes.synopsis: On Election Day, Bartlet and his staff begin counting exit poll votes across the country.
episodes.title: Election Night

episodes.synopsis: As the White House staffers rejoice after Bartlet's win, a bizarre congressional race in a conservative California district gives them an idea.
episodes.title: Process Stories

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet ponders political ramifications of honoring a request from the Iranian Ayatollah to allow his son to fly to the U.S. for life-saving surgery.
episodes.title: Swiss Diplomacy

episodes.synopsis: Sam prepares his congressional campaign and refers talented campaign manager Will Bailey to Toby for a review of Will's speechwriting skills.
episodes.title: Arctic Radar

episodes.synopsis: A winter storm blankets the northeast as a staffer gets a surprising visit from his father, and Bartlet and Leo start to hear the footsteps.
episodes.title: Holy Night

episodes.synopsis: The staff joins together to fight a losing battle on a foreign aid vote in the Senate.
episodes.title: Guns not Butter

episodes.synopsis: C.J. reluctantly returns home to Ohio, to speak at her 20-year high school reunion. Her visit includes an encounter with a rich, handsome classmate.
episodes.title: The Long Goodbye

episodes.synopsis: A situation in an unimportant country on the other side of the world has Bartlet and his staff rewriting his address on the eve of his inauguration.
episodes.title: Inauguration: Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Preparations for the presidential inauguration continue as the White House cancels Bartlet's speech and moves closer to historic military action.
episodes.title: Inauguration:Part 2: Over There

episodes.synopsis: En route to California to support Sam's troubled campaign, Bartlet and his staff debate whether or not to announce a controversial tax plan.
episodes.title: The California 47th

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet waits tensely for the results of a military strike intended to rescue three captive American soldiers in Africa.
episodes.title: Red Haven's on Fire

episodes.synopsis: Upset because an antiabortion provision has been attached to a foreign aid bill, Abbey asks Amy to secretly help defeat the bill.
episodes.title: Privateers

episodes.synopsis: As Air Force One is about to land, a cockpit indicator light leads the crew to believe that the landing gear might not be locked down.
episodes.title: Angel Maintenance

episodes.synopsis: After a gunman fires three shots at the White House, the staff remains on lockdown. Meanwhile, Bartlet negotiates the return of a downed spy plane.
episodes.title: Evidence of Things Not Seen

episodes.synopsis: A seemingly benign press leak begins a journey that ends with the discovery of a scandal affecting the uppermost levels of the administration.
episodes.title: Life on Mars

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet struggles with the message that he wants to convey to his youngest daughter Zoey's graduating class at Georgetown University.
episodes.title: Commencement

episodes.synopsis: In the season finale, Bartlet confronts a national crisis on the night of his daughter Zoey's graduation from Georgetown University.
As the White House reels from the kidnapping of Zoey, the government is temporarily passed from the distraught Bartlet to the Republican party.
episodes.title: 7A Wf 83429

episodes.synopsis: The crisis concerning the abduction of Bartlet's daughter reaches a critical point as House Speaker Walken orders the bombardment of terrorist camps.
episodes.title: The Dogs of War

episodes.synopsis: Following a harrowing chapter in the nation's history, the White House celebrates the Fourth of July.
episodes.title: Jefferson Lives

episodes.synopsis: A renowned North Korean pianist is greeted at the White House for a performance, but the musician informs the president he wants to defect.
episodes.title: Han

episodes.synopsis: After Josh is hailed as the "101st Senator" in a newspaper profile, he clashes with conservative Senator Carrick, a Democrat from Idaho.
episodes.title: Constituency of One

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet is preoccupied with a killer tornado in Oklahoma and flies there to lend his support. But his compassion overrules good judgment.
episodes.title: Disaster Relief

episodes.synopsis: The president's staff wrangles with the new Speaker of the House over the federal budget. Toby checks on the condition of the elderly Chief Justice.
episodes.title: Separation of Powers

episodes.synopsis: A disastrous fiscal crisis looms when the federal government is shut down after a disagreement over an extra 2 percent in budget reductions.
episodes.title: Shutdown

episodes.synopsis: The festive spirit at the annual White House tree-lighting ceremony is dimmed when the president learns that relief workers have been jailed in Sudan.
episodes.title: Abu el Banat

episodes.synopsis: When a former president of the United States dies, the two remaining ex-presidents fly on Air Force One with Bartlet to attend the funeral.
episodes.title: The Stormy Present

episodes.synopsis: Toby finishes the State of the Union Address a few weeks early, and a pregnant Joey Lucas polls responses to the speech from everyday people.
episodes.title: The Benign Prerogative

episodes.synopsis: Toby convinces Bartlet to secretly sanction his solo attempt to make history by reforming Social Security.
episodes.title: Slow News Day

episodes.synopsis: When a secret nuclear detonation is detected over the Indian Ocean, Bartlet calls for an investigation into which nation now has the atomic bomb.
episodes.title: The Warfare of Genghis Khan

episodes.synopsis: When five crew members of a Thunderchief are shot down by North Korean jets near the hostile country, President Bartlet dispatches a Navy SEAL team.
episodes.title: An Khe

episodes.synopsis: The Bartlet administration reels from press leaks that the former vice president is preparing a tell-all book that will embarrass the president.
episodes.title: Full Disclosure

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet becomes furious when a rival conservative congresswoman tries to end funding for a controversial National Institute of Health medical study.
episodes.title: Eppur Si Muove

episodes.synopsis: When a Republican Supreme Court justice suddenly dies, the Bartlet administration scrambles to find a worthy replacement.
episodes.title: The Supremes

episodes.synopsis: Producing a program on past and present White House press secretaries, a television documentary crew follows C.J. around to film a "typical" day.
episodes.title: Access

episodes.synopsis: On the eve of the president's summit meeting in Brussels, Josh learns Bartlet will reverse his position on the loss of jobs to foreign nations.
episodes.title: Talking Points

episodes.synopsis: After attending a formal dinner elsewhere, Bartlet and his staff return to the White House and experience an emergency quarantine in the West Wing.
episodes.title: No Exit

episodes.synopsis: Donna and Adm. Fitzwallace travel with a few Congressmen to the hotly disputed Gaza Strip on a fact-finding mission.
episodes.title: Gaza

episodes.synopsis: After the murders of high-ranking U.S. officials in the explosive Gaza Strip, Bartlet weighs appropriate military action.
episodes.title: Memorial Day

episodes.synopsis: In the aftermath of the Gaza attack that seriously wounded Donna and killed Adm. Fitzwallace, Bartlet faces strong opposition to his peace plans.
episodes.title: NSF Thurmont

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet arranges for representatives from Israel and Palestine to visit Camp David in Maryland for peace negotiations.
episodes.title: The Birnam Wood

episodes.synopsis: Before signing the Middle East peace accord, Bartlet orders his staff to enlist the support of the U.S. House and the United Nations.
episodes.title: Third-Day Story

episodes.synopsis: An emissary from the Republic of Georgia visits the White House and offers weapons-grade uranium stored in a research reactor Russia left behind.
episodes.title: Liftoff

episodes.synopsis: New press secretary Annabeth Schott has been on the job for only a week and is preparing to encounter the press corps for the first time.
episodes.title: The Hubbert Peak

episodes.synopsis: The U.S. peacekeeping compound is attacked, and American soldiers are killed. The father of a slain soldier speaks out against the mission.
episodes.title: The Dover Test

episodes.synopsis: Preparations are being made for Bartlet's visit to China when he accepts a flag from the delegation representing the Taiwanese Independence Movement.
episodes.title: A Change is Gonna Come

episodes.synopsis: At a Bartlet family birthday, magicians Penn & Teller burn the American flag in the White House, prompting a publicity nightmare.
episodes.title: In the Room

episodes.synopsis: As Bartlet and his staff arrive in China for a critical meeting, the president is still suffering the paralyzing effects of multiple sclerosis.
episodes.title: Impact Winter

episodes.synopsis: The press circulates a rumor about C.J. An amendment banning gay marriage is added to the budget. Josh convinces Santos to run for president.
episodes.title: Faith Based Initiative

episodes.synopsis: Josh goes to New Hampshire with Santos to establish their campaign headquarters. But personal differences about the campaign's goals become evident.
episodes.title: Opposition Research

episodes.synopsis: The day after the president's annual State of the Union address, the harried staff deals with one emergency situation after another.
episodes.title: 365 Days

episodes.synopsis: Iowa is the location for the first presidential debate. At the Iowa Corn Growers' Expo, Vice President Russell gives the first speech.
episodes.title: King Corn

episodes.synopsis: On Valentine's Day, an Iranian fighter jet accidentally shoots down a British passenger plane, killing 100. C.J. is reluctant to awaken the president.
episodes.title: The Wake Up Call

episodes.synopsis: Five days before the New Hampshire primary, a desperate Josh must get his trailing candidate into the local debate with the two front-runners.
episodes.title: Freedonia

episodes.synopsis: Russell appears to be the frontrunner for the Democratic nomination for president, but a new contender gives an amazing speech.
episodes.title: Drought Conditions

episodes.synopsis: Congressman Santos masterminds a plot to pass the president's stem cell bill while the Republicans aren't paying attention.
episodes.title: A Good Day

episodes.synopsis: Santos is pressured to reveal his stand on California legislation that would prevent illegal immigrants from obtaining driver's licenses.
episodes.title: La Palabra

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet is propelled into a dubious conundrum: continue talks with Cuba's ailing dictator and lift sanctions or yield to bipartisan political fallout.
episodes.title: Ninety Miles Away

episodes.synopsis: After winning the Republican nomination for presidency, Arnold Vinick begins working on his campaign but must account for not attending church.
episodes.title: In God We Trust

episodes.synopsis: The success of the impeccably organized Republican Convention contrasts with the Democrats who look in disarray as the candidates continue to battle.
episodes.title: Things Fall Apart

episodes.synopsis: At the Democratic National Convention, the race to become the presidential nominee has narrowed to three candidates: Russell, Hoynes and Santos.
episodes.title: 2162 Votes

episodes.synopsis: As Bartlet's time in the White House comes to an end, two formidable men vie for the Presidency: Arnold Vinick and Matthew Santos.
episodes.title: The Ticket

episodes.synopsis: As a grand jury convenes to investigate the White House military shuttle leak, the campaign's focus changes to national security.
episodes.title: The Mommy Problem

episodes.synopsis: Vinick undermines the Santos campaign by targeting immigration issues, a topic Santos had previously successfully avoided.
episodes.title: Message of the Week

episodes.synopsis: Since several members of the staff have been subpoenaed to testify in the military shuttle leak investigation, C.J. is left to run the office.
episodes.title: Mr. Frost

episodes.synopsis: After answering questions from White House Counsel Oliver Babish, Toby concludes that he needs to retain counsel.
episodes.title: Here Today

episodes.synopsis: A third-party attack on Santos brings unwanted attention to both his and Vinick's stance on abortion. Meanwhile, Will gets a promotion.
episodes.title: The Al Smith Dinner

episodes.synopsis: Congressman Matt Santos and Senator Arnold Vinick participate in a tension-filled debate.
episodes.title: The Debate

episodes.synopsis: Santos visits an African American family whose child was shot by a Latino police officer. C.J. manages a crisis between China and Kazakhstan.
episodes.title: Undecideds

episodes.synopsis: On the eve of Ellie's White House wedding, a military situation in Central Asia takes Bartlet away from the rehearsal festivities.
episodes.title: The Wedding

episodes.synopsis: Leo struggles through debate practice and makes Josh and Lou extremely nervous. Meanwhile, Santos gets a brief respite from the campaign trail.
episodes.title: Running Mates

episodes.synopsis: C.J. is in the process of negotiating a deal between Russia and China when some potentially embarrassing information about Bartlet surfaces.
episodes.title: Internal Displacement

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet must face the possibility of a nuclear reactor meltdown in California. In the midst of this emergency, the presidential campaign goes on.
episodes.title: Duck and Cover

episodes.synopsis: The effects of a nuclear scare in California continue to shake things up on both sides of the campaign trail.
episodes.title: The Cold

episodes.synopsis: As the end of the campaign trail nears, the candidates feel the burden more than ever.
episodes.title: Two Weeks Out

episodes.synopsis: The attorney general pressures Toby to reveal his source on the shuttle leak. Meanwhile, Santos continues his dizzying tour of the country.
episodes.title: Welcome to Wherever You Are

episodes.synopsis: The night before Election Day becomes even more meaningful for two staffers. Josh stresses over returns, while C.J. is faced with future job offers.
episodes.title: Election Day

episodes.synopsis: As the polls close and the results are tallied, emotions run high. Santos and Josh face the loss of their vice presidential candidate.
episodes.title: Election Day, Part II

episodes.synopsis: Bartlet and his current staff -- as well as some friends from the past -- come together for Leo's funeral.
episodes.title: Requiem

episodes.synopsis: A controversy occurs when the president-elect places a telephone call to the president of China and espouses a different viewpoint than Bartlet's.
episodes.title: Transition

episodes.synopsis: While Santos is wrapped up in choosing his new vice president, Helen is overwhelmed by the issues facing the new first family.
episodes.title: The Last Hurrah

episodes.synopsis: As the Bartlet administration prepares to transition into the Santos administration, C.J. must confront the choices affecting her future.
episodes.title: Institutional Memory

episodes.synopsis: As the Bartlet administration prepares to leave the West Wing, C.J. and the others fondly look back on their time in the White House.
episodes.title: Tomorrow
